item.title: Notes on Econometrics - Practice Part
item.description: Compare Models Choose Explanatory Variables Choose Approach: OLS / GLS Weird Model R Workout Data Generation OLS Regression Warning: under proofreading All I wanted was a clear & complete guidance (for upcoming exams). Textbook: A Guide to Modern Econometrics Compare Models Choose Explanatory Variables PS2.Q3 Consider the wage regressions from slide 5 (text P86). 1. Compute F-statistics for comparing the loglinear model with and without squared experience.

item.title: Notes on Econometrics - Theory Part
item.description: Tests & Statistics \(R^2\) t-test F-test (Joint Test) Wald Test J Test PE Test Chow (Breakpoint) Test Sargan Test (Overidentifying Restrictions Test) Durbin-Wu-Hausman Test (Endogeneity Test) Read Regression Table Gauss-Markov Assumptions OLS Error Normality of \(ε\) Unbiasedness of \(s^2\) Consistency of \(s^2\) OLS Estimator Derive OLS Normality of \(b\) Unbiasedness of \(b\) Consistent of \(b\) (Asymptotic) Efficienty BLUE (Best Linear Unbiased Estimator) CAN (Consistent and Asymptotically Normal) OLS Model Converge in Probability & Mean Square LLN (Law of Large Numbers) Elasticity IV (Instrument Variable) Derive IV IV Estimator \(\hat{β}_{IV}\) GIVE (Generalized IV Estimator) Heteroskedasticity & Autocorrelation White (Hetero-Consistent) Standard Error HAC (Robust) Standard Error Maximum Likelihood Model Warning: under proofreading

item.title: About
item.description: Hello. I’m loikein from China. Welcome to my academic blog. Currently I live in Bonn, Germany for my master’s study in economics. My research interests include microeconomic theory, experimental economics and game theory. I am also interested in computer science. I speak Chinese (native), Japanese (near native) and English (academic proficient). If you are a Chinese user, you may also want to check my personal blog: Untitled Life. This theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui and me.

item.title: Rmd Template
item.description: Words of Warning Rmd Reference Reference Cheatsheet Inline Code Executed Display Code R Code Chunk R Code (Inline) Code from Other Languages Reference Image Reference Plot Words of Warning I use Typora to write my posts. It usually processes .Rmd file correctly, but it gets lost in a file as complicated as this one. Always check twice and preview the .html page. DO NOT put spaces right after and before the \(\LaTeX\) $ $ pair or the expression will not be rendered properly.
